Description: Postcard; printed paper; hand coloured photograph showing boats moored at Port Said with the lighthouse at the rear.
Curator's comments: Old card; postally used. Card numbered "3" in a series. Message reads: "Wednesday morning. Just arrived here all right. Horrid hard passage. I didn't get up at all, it was very rough all the time. Got a letter from [indistinct name] here to say he will meet me at Port Sudan and we have to spend a day there which is rather a mercy. Best love R"
Associated names: Named in inscription: Mrs Boughton Leigh
